page.title: 15Recreation on Beeley Moor
page.content: Footpaths and quiet lanes provide opportunities for rambling. Bridle paths and bye-ways allow people to participate in horse riding. There are plenty of open spaces for flying powered model aeroplanes and a few people have been observed hang gliding. It is a good area for ornithologists and botanists. The Derbyshire Naturalists' Trust have two reserves in the area, access to which requires identity of membership or a permit. Peace and beauty abound to be enjoyed by all. {LIFE STYLES:-}an aerial mast erected in the vicinity of Peasunhurst is for the benefit of lorrydrivers. Those living in the area pursue such activities as horse riding, gardening, bee keeping, embroidery, reading, and television viewing.
